Get ready for an exhilarating day of running and community spirit at the Henley River Half Marathon, 10K & Junior Race, taking place on Saturday, April 11th, 2026, in the beautiful town of Henley-on-Thames, Oxfordshire. Organised by RunThrough Events, this exciting race event promises an unforgettable experience for runners of all levels. Participants can choose from the stunning Half Marathon, the engaging 10K, or the fun Junior Race, all set against the scenic backdrop of the River Thames. 
 
Starting and finishing at the iconic Temple Island Meadows—known for its association with the Royal Henley Rowing Regatta—this mixed-terrain course features undulating trails and breathtaking landscapes. The Half Marathon kicks off at 09:00 am, followed by the 10K at 09:30 am and the Junior Race at 11:30 am. With enthusiastic marshals supporting you along the route and a lively atmosphere to keep you motivated, the Henley River event is a perfect way to welcome spring while supporting the Royal Berks Charity. Don’t miss out on this inspiring day of fitness, fun, and community spirit!

With the option to complete up to 78.6 miles over three thrilling days—equivalent to three marathons—this challenge is perfect for walkers, runners, and those who dare to crawl their way to glory. raw.full_description:
Join us for the exhilarating North Downs Way Ultra Run on Saturday, 10th October 2026, organized by Running Adventures! This 30-mile adventure takes you through the stunning landscapes of Guildford, Surrey, starting and finishing at the charming St Martha's. Experience the beauty of the North Downs Way and the surrounding areas, including the iconic Box Hill. Under the expert guidance of Matt Buck, a seasoned ultra runner and Salomon athlete, you'll navigate scenic trails while enjoying breathtaking views and the camaraderie of fellow participants. 
 
This event is designed for everyone, making it the perfect introduction to ultra running. As you traverse the picturesque Surrey Hills, you'll pass through quaint villages and even the renowned Denbies Wine Estate. After reaching the summit of Box Hill, take a moment to savor a refreshing drink and delicious cake while soaking in the vistas. Remember, this is not a race! You'll run together as a group, fostering a supportive and positive atmosphere. To ensure a rewarding experience, participants should be comfortable running at an average pace of 10 minutes per mile and have trained for at least 22 miles. Don't miss out on this unforgettable journey—sign up today and embrace the thrill of ultra running with Running Adventures!
		 
		 Read more

On Sunday, October 25th, 2026, participants will have the chance to run along the stunning coastal path at Milford on Sea, taking in breathtaking views of the Isle of Wight and the serene Sturt Pond Nature Reserve. This mixed terrain event welcomes runners of all abilities, offering an 'out and back' route where you can choose your own distance, ranging from 5K to an ultra-marathon. 
 
With flexible start times between 8 a.m. and 9:30 a.m., you can join the fun when you're ready, and all runners are required to finish by 3 p.m. Each lap measures 5.3 km (3.28 miles), and all finishers will receive a medal for their achievement. Enjoy the support of aid stations stocked with refreshments, including both sweet and savory options, as you conquer the course. Remember to bring your own cup to stay hydrated throughout the event. Don't miss this opportunity to challenge yourself in a beautiful setting while making lasting memories with fellow runners!

As the final cycling event of the year, the Kent Classic promises to be an unforgettable experience for riders of all levels. 
 
Participants can choose from multiple race distances that wind through the picturesque landscapes of East Sussex and Kent, including scenic routes around the iconic Hever Castle and the beautiful High Weald Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB). Every rider will be rewarded for their hard work with a finisher medal and exciting goodies from our partners. With its accessible routes and stunning scenery, the Kent Classic is a must-attend event for cycling enthusiasts. Get ready for an unforgettable experience at the Thames Trail Ultra, taking place on Saturday, October 24, 2026! Organised by Go Beyond, this exhilarating 47-mile ultra-marathon challenges runners to traverse the stunning Thames Path, from the historic town of Iffley near Oxford to the picturesque Henley-on-Thames. This race, previously known as the Thames Trot, is a beloved fixture on the British ultra-running calendar, offering a perfect blend of breathtaking river views, diverse terrain, and vibrant community spirit.  
 
Runners will tackle a mix of smooth paths and muddy trails, all while enjoying the scenic beauty of the Thames River winding through charming villages and traditional rowing clubs. As an officially recognised UTMB Index Race in the 50K category, the Thames Trail Ultra is a must for any serious ultra-runner looking to earn UTMB points. With five well-stocked aid stations along the route, including delicious Go Beyond fruitcake, participants will be fully supported throughout their journey. Celebrate your achievement with trophies for top finishers and exclusive Go Beyond merchandise for all finishers. Don't miss your chance to challenge yourself and create lasting memories on this iconic course! Sign up now to be part of the Thames Trail Ultra adventure!

Lone Wolf is not just any race; it’s an ultimate endurance challenge where participants can choose their distance—whether it’s a 10k, half marathon, marathon, or ultra marathon.

This exciting event will take place on Sunday, 6th September 2026, in the picturesque Sutton Coldfield, West Midlands. Participants can choose from a variety of race distances including a challenging Half Marathon, a spirited 10K, a fun 5K, or a Junior race, making it the perfect opportunity for runners of all ages and abilities to join in the fun. 
 
As you race through the stunning Sutton Park, one of the largest urban parks in Europe, you’ll be treading along historic roads once graced by GB legends. With race start times kicking off from 9:00 AM for the Half Marathon to 11:30 AM for the Junior race, there’s a perfect fit for everyone. Not only will you be enjoying a fantastic day of running, but you'll also be supporting a worthy cause—Birmingham Children’s Hospital. Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at the Race The Sun Lake District event, taking place on Saturday, September 5th, 2026, in the picturesque town of Keswick, Cumberland. Organized by Action Medical Research, this exhilarating team challenge invites participants to embrace the stunning beauty of the Lake District National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, while pushing their limits in a triathlon-style journey that includes biking, hiking, and paddling. 
 
Join forces with a team of two to four and embark on a thrilling 34-mile bike ride that winds through the breathtaking landscapes dominated by Skiddaw, one of the UK’s highest peaks. After cycling, you’ll tackle a challenging 10-mile hike to the summit of Skiddaw, where panoramic views await. Finally, gear up for a 2-mile canoeing adventure on the serene waters of Derwentwater, perfect for both seasoned paddlers and beginners alike. Complete all three challenges, then celebrate your achievements with delicious food and drinks with teammates and loved ones. Don't miss this chance to experience the majestic Lake District while supporting a great cause!

This exhilarating 30-mile ultra run promises a thrilling journey along the breathtaking Jurassic Coast and the beautiful Isle of Purbeck, with a challenging elevation of 4600ft (1400m) that will test both your stamina and spirit!  
 
Starting and finishing at the picturesque Studland Bay beach, this guided run led by an experienced ultra runner and Salomon ambassador will allow you to immerse yourself in the rich history and stunning landscapes of the region. As you traverse the renowned Purbeck Way and make your way to the historic Corfe Castle, you'll be captivated by the magnificent views and natural beauty surrounding you. Along the route, you’ll encounter iconic landmarks such as Kimmeridge Bay, Chapman's Pool, and Durlston Head Castle, all while enjoying the camaraderie of fellow runners. raw.full_description:
Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at the Runningmonks Rollin' 100, taking place on Saturday, July 25, 2026, in the picturesque town of Bishops Castle, Shropshire! Hosted by Runningmonk Trail Events, this exhilarating 100-mile race promises an incredible journey through the stunning landscapes of three counties. Participants will navigate a continuous loop that showcases the breathtaking Shropshire Way, Mortimer Trail, and Offa's Dyke, all while gaining a challenging 16,500 feet in elevation.  
 
Whether you’re a seasoned ultra-runner or a passionate trail enthusiast, the Rollin' 100 offers a unique opportunity to experience the beauty of nature as you traverse trails, forests, and fields. Each runner will be equipped with a tracker to keep friends and family updated on your progress, and you'll receive a finisher's buckle, T-shirt, buff, and access to fully stocked vegan-friendly aid stations to fuel your journey. With supportive volunteers and facilities at Bishops Castle Rugby Club, this event is not to be missed! Make plans to join us for a day of camaraderie, challenge, and celebration in the heart of Shropshire!

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an unforgettable cycling adventure at the Moor to Sea & Dartmoor Legend, taking place on Saturday, July 11, 2026, in the picturesque Exeter, Kennford, Devon. Organized by Sportiva Events, this exciting event promises to showcase some of the best riding that Devon has to offer, featuring stunning coast road sections and the iconic climbs of Dartmoor, including the famous Haytor.  
 
Participants can choose from four fantastic routes designed to challenge cyclists of all levels. The Inspire route spans 34 miles (57 km) with a 2,300 ft ascent, perfect for those looking for a shorter ride. The Challenge route covers 64 miles (103 km) with a 5,700 ft ascent for those seeking a medium-distance challenge. For the seasoned cyclists, the Extreme route offers a thrilling 110-mile (178 km) journey with nearly 10,000 ft of ascent. Finally, the ultimate test awaits with the Legend route, an ultra distance of 200 miles (320 km) and a staggering 20,000 ft of ascent.  
 
Participants will enjoy a fully marked course, well-stocked feed stations, quality cotton T-shirts for early entries, medals for all finishers, and professional chip timing.

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at the Trails in the Alps 2026, organized by Run the Wild! This exhilarating trail running event takes place from Friday, June 26 to Sunday, June 28, 2026, in the stunning backdrop of Saint-Gervais-les-Bains, Haute-Savoie. Experience the thrill of running through vibrant alpine meadows adorned with wildflowers and enjoy breathtaking views of the majestic Mont Blanc Massif. 
 
Whether you’re a seasoned trail runner or just starting out, this weekend getaway is designed for everyone. You’ll be staying at the brand new Le Saint Gervais Hotel, where you can unwind after exhilarating runs each day. The itinerary includes morning trail runs led by experienced guides, a cultural visit to a local cheese farm, and opportunities to stop at charming mountain buvettes for refreshments. Plus, you'll have the chance to use the cable car to access some of the most breathtaking trails in the region. With a warm and welcoming atmosphere, this event is perfect for making new friends and embracing the spirit of alpine adventure. Don’t miss out on this incredible experience—secure your spot with a deposit of £200 and join us for a weekend of trail running bliss! Full price is £635.

Experience the thrill of the legendary Grinduro gravel ride, scenic road sportive, and exhilarating trail runs, showcasing why the South of Scotland is becoming a top adventure destination in the UK.

raw.full_description:
Get ready for the adventure of a lifetime at the Hadrian's Wall Challenge, organized by Endurotrek! From Friday, June 26 to Sunday, June 28, 2026, join us in Carlisle, Cumbria, as we embark on an exhilarating 80-mile trek along the historic Hadrian's Wall. This three-day challenge will have you averaging a marathon distance each day, inviting participants to embrace the breathtaking landscapes and rich history of this ancient Roman fortification. 
 
Whether you're a casual trekker or a seasoned adventurer, the Hadrian's Wall Challenge offers three entry categories to suit all levels of fitness and ambition: Enjoy, Endeavour, and Endure. With the support of the Endurotrek team, you'll benefit from regular checkpoints, pre-designated campsites with hot showers, and all the amenities you need to recharge after each day's journey. Along the way, you'll traverse rugged terrains, picturesque countryside, and fascinating archaeological sites, creating unforgettable memories as you complete this remarkable challenge. All participants will receive a stylish challenge t-shirt and medal upon finishing, making this an event you won't want to miss!

Join Saturn Running for an exhilarating day at the Lord of The Run - North event, taking place on Sunday, June 21, 2026, in the picturesque setting of Durham, County Durham. This unique running challenge invites participants to embrace the beauty of the River Wear while celebrating the beloved themes from the iconic book and film franchise. Starting at 9:30 AM from the Durham Amateur Rowing Club, runners of all abilities can enjoy a flexible 7-hour time challenge, where the minimum distance is just 5km. You can choose to complete as many laps as you wish, with each full lap measuring 4.37 miles (7km). 
 
Whether you’re a seasoned runner or just looking for a fun day out, the Lord of The Run - North has something for everyone! All finishers will receive a themed medal, with additional distance pins available for those who conquer a half-marathon or more. Don’t forget to indulge in our delicious goody bags, which include options for vegan participants! With a fantastic aid station and a beautiful trail course that showcases stunning views of Durham Cathedral, this event promises to be a memorable experience. Mark your calendars and get ready to run with Saturn Running!

Join us for the exhilarating West Yorkshire Hiking Trail, taking place on Sunday, June 21, 2026, at the stunning Harewood House in Leeds, West Yorkshire, organized by UK Running Events. This exceptional hiking experience immerses participants in the breathtaking natural beauty of the 18th-century estate, which spans over 100 acres of lush woodlands, manicured gardens, and serene lakeside vistas.  
 
The hiking trail promises an adventure for all nature enthusiasts as you meander along the picturesque Wall Side Plantation, ascend to Sugar Hill for panoramic views, and explore the iconic sets of Emmerdale. You’ll also enjoy the tranquility of the Eccup Reservoir, West Yorkshire's largest body of water, surrounded by rich biodiversity. As you navigate through enchanting woodlands, the sights and sounds of nature will accompany you, culminating in a fulfilling finish back at Harewood House. Complete the hike to earn a commemorative medal and a special prize, making this event not just a hike, but a memorable journey through the heart of nature and history. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this unforgettable experience!

Get ready for an exhilarating experience at the ATW Stewartby Lake Triathlon & Aquabike on Sunday, June 21, 2026! Organized by ATW, the largest multisport event organizer in the UK, this event promises an unforgettable day at the picturesque Stewartby Lake. Whether you're a seasoned triathlete or a newcomer to the sport, there’s something for everyone with three race distances to choose from. Participants can opt for the Sprint (750m swim, 26km bike, 5km run), the Standard (1500m swim, 40km bike, 10km run), or the challenging Centurion distance (2250m swim, 80km bike, 20km run), perfect for those training for longer races like the Half Ironman. 
 
The stunning waters of Stewartby Lake offer a pristine setting for an active day filled with community spirit and supportive marshals. With options for Aquabike and relay teams, participants can enjoy a flexible and inclusive atmosphere, welcoming athletes of all abilities. ATW also emphasizes inclusivity by offering categories for all genders. Plus, make the most of your weekend with camping facilities available at the venue! Don't miss your chance to challenge your limits while supporting Alzheimer's Research UK

Participants can choose from a variety of race distances, including the challenging Trail Marathon, Ultra Marathon, Half Marathon, and a fun 10k, making it perfect for runners of all levels.

raw.full_description:
Join us for the exhilarating Jurassic Coast Challenge, a thrilling 75-mile trek that spans over three unforgettable days from July 10 to July 12, 2026. Organized by Endurotrek, this iconic adventure takes you along the breathtaking Jurassic Coast from Abbotsbury to the stunning finish at Studland Bay in Weymouth, Dorset. Experience towering cliffs, hidden coves, and panoramic sea views as you conquer one of the UK's most challenging endurance treks. 
 
The journey kicks off in Abbotsbury, where you'll embark on a 25-mile adventure to Lulworth Cove, followed by another day of scenic beauty as you trek from Lulworth to Kimmeridge. On the final day, push through to Studland Bay, celebrating your achievement against the backdrop of the English Channel. With three entry categories—ENJOY, ENDEAVOUR, and ENDURE—there's a perfect option for everyone, whether you're looking for a leisurely pace or a full expedition challenge. With fully supported checkpoints and new accommodations for 2026, this is an event you won't want to miss. Sign up today and get ready for an unforgettable journey!

Join us for the exhilarating Thursley 10km event on Tuesday, July 7th, 2026, hosted by Running Adventures in the picturesque town of Godalming, Surrey. This unique race offers participants a chance to explore the breathtaking trails of Thursley National Nature Reserve, one of the largest remaining fragments of heathland in the region, spanning an impressive 325 hectares.  
 
The Thursley 10km is an ideal opportunity for trail running first-timers, featuring the flattest terrain offered by Running Adventures. Runners will have the chance to navigate scenic trails, including the acclaimed boardwalk, recently recognized as 'Britain's Favourite Path'. As you embark on this unforgettable journey, you'll be surrounded by the vibrant wildlife of the reserve, which is home to 20 species of dragonflies and damselflies, as well as a delightful variety of birds such as Dartford warblers and long-tailed tits. Whether you're a seasoned runner or looking to connect with fellow enthusiasts, the Thursley 10km promises an uplifting and enjoyable experience amidst nature’s beauty. Don't miss out on this fantastic event!

Get ready for an unforgettable experience at the Richmond Park Half Marathon, hosted by RunThrough Events on Sunday, June 28, 2026! Nestled in one of London’s most picturesque locations, this half marathon invites you to escape the city's hustle and bustle while enjoying the natural beauty of Richmond Park. Participants will complete four scenic laps, winding through stunning woodlands, over gentle hills, and encountering the park's diverse wildlife—keep your eyes peeled for the resident deer! 
 
With a fantastic atmosphere created by the friendly marshals and a lively event village, you'll be supported every step of the way. Enjoy delicious food and drink options, including warm coffee to refuel you after your run. Plus, don’t miss out on the free goodies from our partners waiting for you at the finish line! Whether you are an experienced runner or just starting your journey, the Richmond Park Half Marathon is the perfect event to challenge yourself and celebrate your achievements in a beautiful setting. Join us for a day of fun, fitness, and community spirit in London!

Whether you're a seasoned triathlete or new to the sport, the WILD HORSE BREWING CO. Join us for an exhilarating summer trail running experience at the RunThrough Marlow Trail Run on Sunday, June 28th, 2026, in the picturesque town of Marlow, Buckinghamshire. Organized by RunThrough Events, this exciting off-road race features three distances to cater to all levels of runners: a challenging Half Marathon, an invigorating 10K, and a fun 5K. Set against the stunning backdrop of the Thames Valley and starting at Marlow Rugby Union Football Club, participants can enjoy scenic paths and a welcoming atmosphere as they navigate the well-marked routes through the beautiful local countryside. 
 
The Half Marathon kicks off at 9:00 AM, followed by the 10K at 9:15 AM and the 5K at 9:40 AM. Each race promises a spirited and friendly environment, complete with clear distance markers and supportive marshals. Whether you're a seasoned runner aiming for a personal best or a newcomer tackling your first race, the Marlow Trail Run is the perfect opportunity to connect with nature and fellow enthusiasts while earning a fantastic medal. Don’t miss out on this vibrant community event—mark your calendars and get ready for a day of fun, fitness, and friendship!

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure at the MTC Thames Challenge, hosted by Ultra Running Ltd, taking place from Thursday, August 6th to Sunday, August 9th, 2026, in the picturesque town of Cirencester, Gloucestershire. This exhilarating event is part of the renowned URL Challenger Series and invites participants to tackle the breathtaking journey along England’s longest river path.  
 
Over four action-packed days, you’ll conquer remarkable distances, including the MTC Cotswold Ultra at 57 miles, the MTC Oxford Ultra at 49 miles, the MTC Windsor Ultra at 47 miles, and finally, the MTC Richmond Ultra at 33 miles, culminating at the iconic Thames Gate. For those looking to elevate their challenge, completing both the MTC Thames Challenge and the MTC Severn Challenge in the same year earns you the prestigious “Severn & Thames Buckle.” With hotel accommodation and meals provided at the end of Days 1-3, participants can focus on the thrilling experience ahead. Don’t miss this chance to immerse yourself in the beauty of the Thames while pushing your limits!

Taking place on Saturday, August 29th, 2026, this exciting event invites cyclists of all levels to explore the stunning landscapes of Exmoor. Riders can choose from three fantastic routes: the challenging 100-mile Exmoor Beast, the scenic 65-mile Exmoor Beauty, and the more leisurely 42-mile Exmoor Breeze. Get ready for an exhilarating day of racing at the Marlow Triathlon, organised by RunThrough Events, set to take place on Sunday, 19th July 2026, at the picturesque Higginson Park in Marlow, Buckinghamshire. Following the success of its inaugural event, this triathlon promises to deliver an unforgettable experience filled with excitement and camaraderie. Participants can choose from three race distances: the challenging Half Iron Triathlon featuring a 1.9km swim in the River Thames, an 86km bike ride through rolling hills, and a 20km run; the Olympic Triathlon with a 1.5km swim, a 38km bike ride, and a 10km run; or the Sprint Triathlon, which includes a 750m swim, a 23km bike ride, and a 5km run. 
 
This summer edition of the Marlow Triathlon is not just about the race; it’s about the vibrant atmosphere, the stunning riverside views, and the chance to capture your journey with free race photos. Every participant will receive a unique themed medal and enjoy post-race goodies to celebrate their accomplishment. Don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to finish your summer season strong—sign up

Join us for the exhilarating Castle to Coast Triathlon on Saturday, July 18th, 2026, organized by ATW. This epic point-to-point adventure takes athletes on a breathtaking journey from the serene Dorney Lake near Windsor to the stunning Brighton Sea Front. Experience the thrill of a calm 1.2-mile swim, followed by a challenging 67-mile bike ride through the picturesque rolling Surrey Hills, and finish with a scenic 14-mile trail run across the South Downs.  
 
The Castle to Coast Triathlon is designed for everyone, whether you're a seasoned triathlete or taking on your first event. With a non-competitive sportive format, you can enjoy the beauty of the course alongside friends and fellow participants without the pressure of traditional race rules. Expect fantastic support throughout the event, with well-marked routes, dedicated mechanics, and medical teams ready to assist you at every turn. Plus, transportation back to Windsor is available post-event for your convenience! Don't miss out on this remarkable experience that blends adventure, camaraderie, and stunning scenery. Sign up today and prepare to create unforgettable memories!

Join us for the World War II Peckham & Dulwich 10k Running Tour on Sunday, November 8, 2026, organized by Secret London Runs. This unique event invites runners of all paces to explore the historic impact of World War II on the vibrant neighborhoods of Peckham and Dulwich. Starting at Peckham Rye Station and concluding at Peckham Rye Common, participants will cover a distance of 10 kilometers (6 miles) while learning about the area's significant contributions to the war effort. 
 
This engaging guided tour, led by the knowledgeable Vanessa, promises an enriching experience filled with captivating stories from the past. Runners will also receive digital photos and a delightful finish-line snack to celebrate their achievement. Whether you're a seasoned athlete or a beginner, this event ensures that no one gets left behind—everyone will run at a comfortable pace, making it a perfect outing for friends and families alike. raw.full_description:
Join us for the exhilarating Bridge Triathlon, organized by Bridge Events Dartford, on Sunday, July 5th, 2026! Set against the stunning backdrop of one of the cleanest lakes in South England, this triathlon promises an unforgettable experience for athletes of all levels. Participants can choose from a variety of race distances, including the super sprint, sprint, and standard distances, along with a team relay option. The event features a 1500m swim, 42km bike ride, and 10km run for the standard distance, while the sprint offers a 750m swim, 24km bike, and 5km run. For those looking for a shorter challenge, the GO TRI distance includes a 400m swim, 14km bike, and 3.3km run.

Get ready for an unforgettable running experience at the Bewl Water Summer event, organized by HermesRunning, taking place on Saturday, June 13, 2026, in the stunning surroundings of Wadhurst, East Sussex. Get ready for an exhilarating experience at the Bat Challenge, organized by Big Bear Events! This unique event will take place on Friday, May 8, 2026, in the picturesque town of Loughborough. Participants can look forward to a challenging yet rewarding day and night of trail running, offering stunning views that stretch for miles.  
 
Whether you’re a seasoned runner or just looking to step out of your comfort zone, the Bat Challenge provides a fantastic opportunity to try night trail running. Start your adventure in the warmth of the late spring sun and, if you choose, continue into the enchanting dusk and darkness. The flexible format allows you to run a lap or two in daylight, take a break, and then head out for a thrilling night lap. With support available every 5k, you'll have the confidence to explore the trails, even as the sun sets. Just remember, anyone starting after 7 PM will need to carry a head torch for safety. Runners will enjoy an undulating route that showcases the beauty of the Isle of Wight, featuring old railway lines, open farmlands, and tree-lined woodland paths, all while soaking in breathtaking views along the way.

Be sure to register before the closing date of March 29, 2026, to secure your spot in this unforgettable running adventure! This exhilarating event invites runners to experience the breathtaking beauty of the Harewood House estate, a stunning 18th-century residence nestled within over 100 acres of lush woodlands, beautifully landscaped gardens, and serene lakeside views. 
 
Participants will embark on a scenic journey that includes the Harewood House Half Marathon, showcasing a variety of captivating landscapes. Runners will navigate along the winding tracks of Wall Side Plantation, ascend to the picturesque Sugar Hill, and enjoy the tranquil Eccup Reservoir, West Yorkshire's largest body of water. With the added charm of passing the iconic Emmerdale sets and immersing themselves in nature’s splendor, this event is perfect for both seasoned athletes and nature lovers alike. As you cross the finish line, you’ll be celebrated with a medal and a special prize, marking your achievement in this remarkable adventure. Don’t miss out on this perfect blend of athleticism and natural beauty at the WEST YORKSHIRE TRAIL RUN!

Join us on Saturday, June 20th, 2026, in the beautiful Stanley Park, located in Liverpool, Merseyside. This stunning Grade II* listed park, nestled between the iconic football grounds of Anfield and Goodison Park, is the perfect backdrop for a day of running and community spirit. 
 
Choose between a challenging 10k or a brisk 5k race, both set against the picturesque scenery of one of Liverpool's largest parks. The 5k race kicks off at 9:00 am, while the 10k follows shortly after at 9:10 am. Expect a friendly atmosphere with dedicated marshals cheering you on as you conquer the tarmac paths, boasting an elevation of 43m for the 5k and 85m for the 10k. After crossing the finish line, enjoy a lively event village filled with delicious food and drink options, plus some fantastic goodies from our partners! Don’t miss out on this fantastic opportunity to challenge yourself while soaking in the beauty of Stanley Park!

raw.full_description:
Get ready for an exhilarating day of athleticism at the Bowood House Triathlon, organized by RunThrough Events! On Saturday, June 20, 2026, join us at the stunning Bowood House in Calne, Wiltshire, for an action-packed event featuring both Sprint and Super Sprint distances. Athletes will dive into the refreshing Bowood Lake for an open-water swim, before hitting the closed-road cycle course and finishing with a scenic multi-terrain run through the picturesque grounds.

Get ready for an exhilarating experience at the Chester Triathlon, taking place on Sunday, June 7, 2026, in the beautiful and historic City of Chester, Cheshire West and Chester! This event, organized by Active Leisure Events Ltd, marks its 28th year and promises to deliver an unforgettable day for athletes and spectators alike. Athletes will tackle the Olympic distance triathlon, which has been recognized as a World Standard Distance Triathlon Qualifier for the Deva Olympic distance.  
 
Participants can look forward to a thrilling race that includes a stunning bike route through picturesque Welsh villages and a scenic run that crosses the iconic Old Dee Bridge and the lovely suspension bridge, finishing at the charming Bandstand. New for 2026, the event will also feature the Deva Centurion – 100K and the Deva Short Distance races, along with a standard distance Aquabike. Transitioning in the gorgeous Grosvenor Park, this triathlon promises to be a highlight of the season, showcasing the vibrant atmosphere and rich history of Chester. Join us for a day of athletic achievement and community spirit!

Get ready to ride the wave of excitement at the TSUNAMI OCEAN TRAILS, returning to the stunning North Devon and Cornish coastline on Saturday, June 6, 2026! Organized by OuterEdge Events, this thrilling trail running event offers participants three challenging distances to choose from: an ULTRA 37 miles, a marathon, and the SIXTEEN. Each race culminates on the picturesque lawns of Castle Bude, providing a breathtaking backdrop for your triumphant finish.  
 
With bus transport available to each start location—Westward Ho! for the Ultra, Clovelly for the Marathon, and Hartland Quay for the SIXTEEN—getting to the starting line has never been easier. Prepare yourself for a rollercoaster of a race, featuring massive ascents and descents that will test even the most seasoned runners. The OuterEdge checkpoints are well-stocked and managed by fellow runners, ensuring you have everything you need to conquer this tough route. Whether you're aiming to cross the finish line with a bespoke medal in hand or simply looking to challenge yourself, the TSUNAMI OCEAN TRAILS promises an unforgettable experience for trail running enthusiasts. Get ready for an unforgettable challenge at The ONER, taking place on Saturday, June 6, 2026, in the stunning coastal town of Portland, Dorset. Organized by Epic Endurance Events Ltd., this iconic event invites participants to conquer 85 miles of the breathtaking Jurassic Coast within a demanding 24-hour timeframe. Since its inception in 2007, The ONER has evolved into one of the UK’s toughest coastal foot races, drawing around 100 intrepid runners each year who take on the cliffs, beaches, and rugged trails of this UNESCO World Heritage Site.  
 
Whether you choose to run, walk, or crawl, The ONER is more than just a race; it’s a true test of endurance, determination, and spirit. With a legacy of grit and camaraderie, this legendary event continues to inspire and challenge all who dare to participate. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this remarkable experience!

This exciting event will take place from Friday, June 5th to Saturday, June 6th, 2026, in the picturesque town of Fishguard, Pembrokeshire. Set against the stunning backdrop of the Pembrokeshire coastline, participants can test their endurance in a variety of thrilling races, including a challenging Half Marathon, a scenic 10K, and the all-new Fishguard 5K designed for first-time racers.  
 
For the younger athletes, the Kids Race will kick off the festivities, offering children aged 4 to 11 the chance to choose their distance—200m, 400m, or 1km—while all participants will receive a T-shirt and medal. Swim enthusiasts won’t want to miss the exhilarating sheltered sea swim in Fishguard Bay, paired with an epic Aquabike event featuring a ride to St Davids and back. With breathtaking sea views and a vibrant atmosphere, the Fishguard Multi Sport Festival promises to be an exhilarating celebration of sport and community! Join us for this unforgettable weekend of grit and determination in one of Britain’s most beautiful locations!
